headline: Costco’s Sales Rise Ahead of Earnings Report. What’s Fueling the Growth.
summary: Costco  Wholesale released both its November and fiscal first-quarter sales.  Fiscal first-quarter sales were $65.98 billion, an increase of 8.2% from a year ago.  This figure doesn’t include any revenue stemming from Costco’s membership fees, which will be disclosed on the company’s Dec. 11 earnings report.

headline: Costco Wholesale Corporation Reports November Sales Results
summary: ISSAQUAH, Wash., Dec. 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Costco Wholesale Corporation (“Costco” or the “Company”) (Nasdaq: COST) today reported net sales of $23.64 billion for the retail month of November, the four weeks ended November 30, 2025, an increase of 8.1 percent from $21.87 billion last year. For the twelve-week first quarter ended November 23, 2025, the Company reported net sales of $65.98 billion, an increase of 8.2 percent from $60.99 billion last year. headline: FACT FOCUS: Trump says tariffs can eventually replace federal income taxes. Experts disagree
summary: President Donald Trump has long praised tariffs as key to increasing wealth in the United States, idealizing Gilded Age policies that preceded the implementation of a modern federal income tax.  Among the potential benefits, Trump claims, is the ability to replace revenue from federal income taxes with money the U.S. is taking in from tariffs — a concept he has touted since his 2024 presidential campaign, most recently at a Cabinet meeting Tuesday.  CLAIM: The U.S. is earning enough revenue from tariffs to eventually eliminate federal income taxes.

headline: Why GXO Logistics (GXO) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of contract logistics company GXO (NYSE:GXO) jumped 3.1% in the afternoon session after the stock's positive momentum continued as the company reached a two-year pay agreement with its drivers in Motherwell, ending a period of labor disputes. The union Unite confirmed it secured a significant pay win for the drivers, who deliver supplies for major companies including Costco and Superdrug. headline: US retail giant Costco challenges Trump tariffs in court
summary:
Costco, the major members-only warehouse retailer, has sued US President Donald Trump's administration, demanding a refund for tariffs it has paid on imported goods, according to a lawsuit reviewed by AFP.
The suit, filed November 28 at the US Court of International Trade, argues the tariffs are illegal.But according to the documents filed by its lawyers, Costco fears that even if the Supreme Court rules the tariffs illegal, it will not be reimbursed for what it has already paid to US tax author

headline: Roundhill Investments Launches UNH WeeklyPay™ ETF (Ticker: UNHW)
summary: Roundhill Investments, an ETF sponsor focused on innovative ETFs, today announced the launch of the Roundhill UNH WeeklyPay™ ETF (UNHW), which begins trading on Cboe BZX today.

headline: Costco sues Trump administration to halt tariffs and secure refunds
summary: Costco has filed a lawsuit in the US Court of International Trade to halt Trump-era tariff collections and secure refunds for duties already paid.

headline: 2 Reasons to Like COST and 1 to Stay Skeptical
summary: Over the past six months, Costco’s shares (currently trading at $921.09) have posted a disappointing 12.7% loss, well below the S&P 500’s 14.1% gain. This may have investors wondering how to approach the situation.
